channel.title: How the fuck do i fix duping!
channel.description:
i have this problem.... well, i have had it for years with this server type :P there used to be a tut on how to fix it, it seems to have disappeared.
instructions on how the dupe works:
[317] DUPE IN TRADING: [317]
player 1: places an item up and accepts. player 2: accepts, leading to the second trade screen. player 1: accepts the trade player 2: right clicks accept and puts his mouse ON "ok" above the cancel button and double clicks.
this causes the trade to accept, giving player 2 the items, and it also causes it to decline, causing player 1 to get their items back.
i have tried fixing this dupe. but i dont know where to even start. i thought it might be something in the button cases maybe?
as many details as i could give you. please help

item.title: How the fuck do i fix duping!
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

O wow…
I suggest using the countless guides to fix this.
They tried there best to explain it, but there are more explained details.

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck do i fix duping!
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

[quote=“WaleedScape, post:3, topic:353905”][quote author=itai link=topic=450202.msg3302491#msg3302491 date=1281403994]
Open Client.java
Declare:

public boolean tradeAccepted;

Find:

declineTrade(boolean tellOther)

Just put under that line

if(!tradeAccepted){

and add a } to the end of declineTrade method.
Now find:

public void openTrade()

Under it put:

tradeAccepted = false;

Close client.java and open ClickingMost.java
Now find:

(other.tradeConfirmed2)

and above that put

c.tradeAccepted = true;

The in case 103 remove

if (inTrade && (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastButton > 1000)) {

[/quote]
aww, you beat me to it :P[/quote]
I am awesome like that

Read full topic

and above that put

c.tradeAccepted = true;

The in case 103 remove

aww, you beat me to it

i have this problem… well, i have had it for years with this server type
